subhead: France has one of the lowest union membership rates in Europe. Since the early 1990s, trade unions have struggled to attract new members.

El Salvador: From 'Surf City' beaches to overflowing prisons, the two sides of the Bukele model
subhead: President Nayib Bukele has propelled El Salvador to the top of the world ranking for incarceration rates, with nearly 1.7% of the population behind bars. At the same time, the Central American state has welcomed 3.5 million tourists, far outpacing Costa Rica.

headline: French national library seeks patrons to acquire rare archive of Marcel Proust's works
subhead: Drafts, sketches, unpublished fragments, manuscripts of poems... The institution launched a public fundraising campaign at the beginning of September to ensure that these 900 items, valued at €7.7 million, remain part of France's national heritage.

headline: 'The Ice Tower': A visual gem by Lucile Hadzihalilovic
subhead: Inspired by a Hans Christian Andersen fairy tale, the film introduces the young and captivating actress Clara Pacini across from the Snow Queen sublimely portrayed by Marion Cotillard.

headline: 'The more Europe gives in to Trump's blackmail, the more they appear to Beijing as vassals of the US'
subhead: Europe is struggling to heed the lesson from this summer's diplomatic drama: Unlike them, the US president does not see Vladimir Putin as an adversary, writes Le Monde columnist Sylvie Kauffmann.

headline: An abbey in southern France rescued by contemporary art
subhead: 'Strange places for an exhibition' (6/6). Le Monde explores six art centers set up in unusual locations. Today: a magnificent Cistercian abbey rescued from ruin by Geneviève Bonnefoi and Pierre Brache.

headline: The Paris district where Parisians are priced out
subhead: In 50 years, the 8th arrondissement of the French capital, home to the Champs-Elysées and the 'Golden Triangle,' has lost nearly half its population. The mass acquisition of real estate by ultra-wealthy foreigners has driven locals out.
